page.title: 18Cockermouth Town Council
page.content: Established in 1974 as a third-tier consultative body in local government, the Town Council has twelve elected members from two Wards (Castle and All Saints'). There are 2400 voters in Castle Ward and 2800 in All Saints' Ward. The Town Mayor acts as Chairman at the monthly meetings in the Town Hall. Committees meet in the Victoria Hall. Councillors are elected and serve for four years. The Council is responsible for allotment gardens, tourism and publicity, the Victoria Hall (a refurbished chapel), Christmas illuminations and twinning with Marvejols. The Council is proud of the refurbished Victoria Hall, the twinning with Marvejols and the eighty five voluntary associations and clubs active in the town and district. The council would like to establish a Heritage Trail (Fletcher Christian).
